info.description:
This API suite contains a set of API methods to allow a customer to access and maintain their permissions.

This supports the following permission categories:-
* MARKETING permissions.   These are the set of GDPR permissions relating to communications with the customer for marketing or promotional purposes.
* OPERATIONAL permissions.  These are a set of operational preferences.
* PAYMENT permissions.   These relate to how storage and usage of a customer credit card details ( if any).

get.summary: Retrieve all permissions for the current user
get.description:
This API method returns all permissions for the current user.

As such this assumes that a user has previously been appropriately authenticated.

parameters.name: categoryFilter
parameters.description: If supplied, this will filter the set permissions by 'category'.

parameters.name: codeFilter
parameters.description:
If supplied, this will filter the set permissions by 'code'. 
If supplied then the 'category' filter must also be supplied

200.description: Succesful Response.  Any matching permissions will be returned.

get.summary: Retrieve all permissions for the current user by category and code
get.description:
This API method returns all permissions for the current user.

As such this assumes that a user has previously been appropriately authenticated.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category of the permissions to be retrieved.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code for the subset of permissions to be retrieved.

200.description: Succesful Response.  Any matching permissions will be returned.

Category.description:
* 'MARKETING'    - This category of permissions records GDPR related consent decisions by a customer.
* 'PAYMENT'      - This category of permissions records 'Credit Card on file' related consent decisions by a customer.
* 'OPERATIONAL'  - This category of permissions records adhoc operational oreferences.

State.description:
* 'GRANTED'  - The permission is granted by the user or by an agent on behald of a user.
* 'DENIED'  - The permission is denied by the user or by an agent on behald of a user.
* 'UNKNOWN'  - The state of the permission is unknown.  This is a default state when a user has not provided a choice.

code.description: * 'COF'  - If true, the customer is happy that the payment card be stored and used for future payments.

differentiator.description:
The differentiator is an optional property.

It is used where there are multiple permissions with the same code as in this instance it allows a particularthe permission to be uniquely identified.

The value supplied in the differnetiator is not defined in this API specification as it is defined in
the API implementation on a 'per code' basis.

e.g. The 'COF' property uses the 'token-id' as the differntiator.   This allows the 'COF' permission to be quickly
associated with a card (That information would also likely be available in the metadata but supplying it in the
differentiator makes it easier to access for summary purposes)

code.description:
* 'EMAIL'  - If true, the customer is happy to be contacted for marketing purposes by email.
* 'PHONE'  - If true, the customer is happy to be contacted for marketing purposes by phone.
* 'POST'   - If true, the customer is happy to be contacted for marketing purposes by post.
* 'SMS'    - If true, the customer is happy to be contacted for marketing purposes by an SMS message.
* 'THIRDPARTY_EMAIL'   - If true, the customer is happy to be contacted for marketing purposes by a third party by email.
* 'THIRDPARTY_POST'   - If true, the customer is happy to be contacted for marketing purposes by a third party by post.

* 'POD'  - If true, the customer requests 'Proof of Delivery' (POD) to be the default option on all future orders.
* 'VAT_RECEIPT'  - If true, the customer requires a VAT Receipt on all future sales orders.  The customer may also choose a deliery method for these receipts in the metadata property
* 'SUBWINE' - If true, it expresses a preference that the vustomer is happy to receive substitute wines in a case where the original wine choice is no longer available. 
* 'THIRDPARTY_LIT' - If true, the customer is happy to receive third party literature in the case on any order.

createdDate.description: The date and time when the permssion was first created.

modifiedDate.description: The date and time when the permssion was last modified.

actionedBy.description:
This is a text field indicating contaions one of the following:-
* The ID of the agent who updated the permission on behalf of the customer  OR
* The reserved keyword 'WEBSITE' which denotes the customer updated the permssion themselves via the website.
